All Shrine Locations and Solutions

By Miranda Sanchez, Laura May Randell, Brendan Graeber, +55 more
updatedSep 4, 2023

Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom has a total of 152 Shrines – 120 on the Surface and 32 in the Sky. There are no Shrines in the Depths but there are Lightroots to discover that act as fast travel points similar to Shrines. Each shrine contains a mini-dungeon of puzzles to solve and loot including at least one Treasure Chest and a Light of Blessing. If you've retrieved the Treasure Chest from a Shrine, it's name will have "chest" marker beside it when you put your cursor over it on the map.

advertisement

In this TotK Shrine Guide you'll find walkthroughs for shrines, and most importantly, how to find and complete them across the two maps. Some shrines are hidden in caves or even off the map, locked away by a shrine quest. Landing in Hyrule with little to no direction as to which Shrines are the closest or easiest can be a bit daunting, so we've also put together a list of the Best Shrines to Complete First.

Tears of the Kingdom Shrine Map

advertisement

Use our Interactive Map for Tears of the Kingdom to locate them all or continue on this page for a list of all Shrines by region.

Shrine Rewards

advertisement

Collect 4 Lights of Blessing to bring to a Goddess Statue (like the one in the Emergency Shelter in Lookout Landing) to expand your Heart Containers or Stamina bar.

TOTK Shrines contain a variety of challenges: Some are small dungeons that feature a central puzzle theme that exercise your skills like Ascension, Ultra Hand, and Recall. Others contain Constructs that test Link's combat skills and range from relatively easy to fairly difficult.

advertisement

There are also "free" shrines: These shrines don’t have puzzles themselves, but may be a reward for Shrine Quests or accomplishing another feat, like merely reaching a difficult-to-reach Shrine.

Locating Shrines

You can use our Tears of the Kingdom Interactive Map to find all of the Shrines and explore locations and puzzle solutions as shared on this guide as well, but here are tips for finding Shrines:

Tips to Find Shrines in TotK

  • Shrines appear as a green, glowing source of light, and you can see them much better at night, and from the Sky. If you click the RIGHT STICK and use your telescopic pad function to mark them you can easily track them.
  • Shrines are located in the Sky and the Depths as well as the Surface. The Coordinates we provide in the Shrine Guide below will help you determine if a Shrine is above or below you.
  • The Shrine of Light Sensor can be obtained from the Hateno Village Research Lab and activated by Robbie after you’ve completed one temple and advanced the Lookout Landing Side Adventures that take you to the Depths called Hateno Village Research Lab. This will indicate a nearby Shrine, even a hidden one, and now adds some detail about whether it’s below or above you.
  • Note that some Shrines aren't always visible nor will they be tracked through the Shrine of Light Sensor, and you might need to talk to a character with a red mark (this indicates Side Quests to start Shrine Quests to solve riddles to reveal their location.
  • Shrines also serve as your key points of fast travel in Tears of the Kingdom.You don’t have to complete a Shrine to make it a fast travel point: You just need to activate the green seal in front of the shrine. You can return later to solve the puzzle.
  • Every Shrine has at least one treasure chest. Your map icon will turn fully blue when you’ve completed a Shrine, but it will stay partially orange if you haven’t found the Shrine exit and Light of Blessing OR if you haven’t found all of the chests.
  • Most Shrines are on the Surface. There are no Shrines in the Depths but there are Shrines in the Sky. Note that the Depths have Light Roots the illuminate the Depths and the map in of the Depths, and their locations correlate with the Shrines above them.

Central Hyrule Shrines Guide and Locations

The 18 Central Hyrule Shrines can be completed in any order but are numbered in the shrine map below for your convenience.

advertisement

  • 1.Yamiyo Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Yamiyo Shrine can be found in the Romani Plains in Central Hyrule, due east of Hyrule Castle Town Ruins and north east of Lookout Landing and the Lookout Landing Skyview Tower.

Coordinates: 0332, 0470, 0029

  • 2. Kyononis Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Kyononis Shrine is on the ground in Central Hyrule in plain view, due north of Lookout Landing and Lookout Landing Skyview Tower. Bring a selection of one-handed weapons to the shrine. Even a stick will be fine for the training you get here.

advertisement

Coordinates: -0205, 0451, 0021

  • 3. Ishodag Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Ishodag Shrine is located on top of a rocky hill due west of Hyrule Castle Town Ruins in Central Hyrule. It is slightly north and a bit further west of Lookout Landing Skyview Tower. To reach the shrine, look for a stone cut overhang on the northern side.

Coordinates: -0880, 0422, 0049

  • 4. Sinakawak Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Sinakawak Shrine is located in the Central Hyrule Region near New Serrene Stable and serves as the warp point for the stable. It is southeast of Lindor’s Brow Skyview Tower and northeast of Lookout Landing. This shrine technically falls into the Hyrule Ridge region, but it labeled as being in Hyrule Field when teleported to it.

advertisement

Coordinates: -1372, 0749, 0086

  • 5. Jiosin Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Jiosin Shrine is located on the ground in Central Hyrule in plain view, due south of Lookout Landing and Lookout Landing Skyview Tower.

Coordinates: -3983, -1084, 0624

  • 6. Susuyai Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Susuyai Shrine can be found on the ground in plain sight in the Passeri Greenbelt in Central Hyrule, southwest of Lookout Landing and the Lookout Landing Skyview Tower.

advertisement

Coordinates: -0785, -0434, 0018

  • 7. Mayachin Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Mayachin Shrine is on the surface in plain sight just north of the Hyrule Field Skyview Tower, in the Exchange Ruins, south and west of Lookout Landing.

Coordinates: 0705, -0865, 003

  • 8. Teniten Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Teniten Shrine is easy to see on the surface, and is located in Central Hyrule south and a bit east of Lookout Landing. It is east of a small lake called Lake Kolomo.

advertisement

Coordinates: -0075, -115, 0021

  • 9. Tajikats Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Tajikats Shrine is on the surface of the bank of the Hylia River in Central Hyrule. It is south and a bit east of Lookout Landing and is near the Riverside Stable, serving as the warp point for the stable.

Coordinates: 0352, -0999, 0016

  • 10. Kamizun Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine is nestled in the trees west of the East Post Ruins, just north of the road.

advertisement

Coordinates: -0177, -1557, 0023

  • 11. Kyokugon Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. Around the Great Plateau's Forest of Spirits, you may get a constant notice that a Shrine of Light is nearby. This shrine is under the plateau in a cave right near Addison and the Hyrule Restoration Materials platform (coordinates -0838, -1482, 0025). You'll find a cave called Great Plateau Foothill Cave.

See theKyokugon Shrine guide for more details on the cave.

Coordinates: -0706, -1551, 0006

  • 12. Tsutsu-um Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This shrine overlooks the Outskirts Stable on a hill to the south of the stable.

Coordinates: -1423, -1349, 0068

  • 13. Riogok Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Riogok Shrine is south of the Outskirt Stable and over the ridge. A fierce foe lurks in the Hopper Pond area, so it's advised you approach this shrine by coming over the hill around it. There's a Shock Like hanging near the shrine as well, so be careful on your approach.

Coordinates: -1440, -1616, 0089

  • 14. Tadarok Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine on the Great Plateau.

To get to this shrine, you'll need to find a cave under Mount Hylia. Its entrance is by the waterfall at the start of the River of the Dead. If you approach the area from the Temple of Time Ruins, look just to the west of the waterfall, and you should see a Blupee. Cross to it (we recommend climbing up to the east side of the waterfall and gliding over to dodge enemies and skip trying to cross the water). Follow the Blupee, and it'll disappear not long after you spotted it. Follow the path behind the waterfall, and you'll get the notification that you've discovered the River of the Dead Waterfall Cave.

Coordinates: -1079, -2185, 0129

advertisement
  • 15. Serutabomac Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Serutabomac Shrine is behind Hyrule Castle on the northeast side of the floating island. One of the best ways to get here early on is by using the Lookout Landing Skyview Tower to get high above the castle then glide over. This is easier still with more stamina and if you've completed the challenge in Rito. Glide over to the long entryway on the first floor of the castle that leads to the throne room. Walk out the exit that leads northeast. There are some good weapons here, though, so be sure to explore!

Once outside climb anything to get some height and glide down and over to the northeastern most part of the now-island and you'll see the shrine on the B1 level of the dungeon.

Coordinates: -0179, 1170, 0280

  • 16. Sepapa Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Sepapa Shrine has a nice river view on the northwest side of the island immediately to the east of Hyrule Castle. It's almost hidden by a small hill, but you'll see the swirling greens that shrines emit at night.

Coordinates: 0220, 1083, 0028

advertisement
  • 17. Ren-iz Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: You'll find this shrine nestled in the remains of a massive carved-out tree near the higher points of the Crenel Hills.

Coordinates: 0756, 0823, 0082

  • 18. Jojon Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. To get to it, you'll need to find the entrance to Crenel Peak Cave. There are two entrances to this shrine, one way easier than the other. For the easy one, go toward Moor Garrison Ruins (southeast of Crenel Peak) and just north of it on the slope of Crenel Peak you'll find an entrance to Crenel Peak Cave. See the Jojon Shrine guide for more specific location directions.

Coordinates: 1205, 0315, 0028

advertisement

Central Hyrule Sky Shrines Guide and Locations

The Central Hyrule Sky shrines include those found in North Hyrule Sky, South Hyrule Sky, and Hyrule Ridge Sky.

  • 1. Jinodok Shrine Guide- Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Jinodok Shrine is located in the South Hyrule Sky Archipelago, west of Great Sky Island and southwest of Hyrule Field Skyview Tower. Approach the shrine location and activate the green hand for instructions. A green beam of light will point you in the direction of the sky crystal.

advertisement

Coordinates: -1256, -1486, 1008

  • 2. Taunhiy Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine requires you to complete a challenge in order to access it!

Taunhiy Shrine is located on a Sky Island in Central Hyrule Sky. From Lindor’s Brow Skyview Tower, launch into the air and pull out your paraglider. Float to the large island with a ring portal on it. Here you can touch a green hand field and activate the falling rings puzzle.

Approach the edge of the island and leap off using the button prompt. Guide link through all the rings. If you miss one, land in the water below, or on the island with the water, and talk to the Zonai construct and it will warp you back to the top for another chance.

If you complete the rings, the Shrine will appear on the sky island near the construct.

Coordinates: -2400, 0824, 0615

  • 3. Simosiwak Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This Shrine is atop an island in the sky above the Great Hyrule Forest, in the North Hyrule Sky Archipelago.

Coordinates: 0163, 1972, 0759

advertisement
  • 4. Mayam Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: From the Thyphlo Ruins Skyview Tower, launch into the air and float south to the cross-shaped island. Activate the shrine pad on the island to begin The North Hyrule Sky Crystal Shrine Quest.

Coordinates: 0340, 2814, 1821

Hebra Shrines Guide and Locations

There are 13 shrines in this area. These are numbered for convenience but can be completed in any order.

advertisement

  • 1. Orochium Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Orochium Shrine is in plain sight just north of the Snowfield Stable in the Hebra Mountains region.

Coordinates: -1641, 2645, 0239

  • 2. Nouda Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Nouda Shrine is located in Kopeeki Drifts Cave in the Kopeeki Drifts, a canyon west and a bit south from South Tabantha Snowfield and Snowfield Stable. Its entrance is on the south wall of the canyon cliffs.

advertisement

Inside you’ll find a large cold pool of water that will damage you on contact. Your task is to make a bridge of ice across this pool to the Nouda Shrine on the far beach. To do so, you’ll need bridge parts.

Coordinates: -2318, 2202, 0173

  • 3. Oromuwak Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Oromuwak Shrine is located just east of Rito Village and serves as the fast travel point for Lucky Clover Gazette. It is perched on a hill surrounded by thorns. You can avoid these thorns by climbing and walking around them, but you can burn them too, if you’d like.

Coordinates: -3079, 1617, 0243

  • 4. Gatakis Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: Gatakis Shrine is located in the lower tier of the Rito Village in Hebra, around the west side. To reach Rito Village, approach from the east and at Lucky Clover Gazette, use the campfire by the downed bridge to create an updraft by throwing a Hylian Pinecone on it. Hylian Pinecones can be found in Central Hyrule, they are in forests and often dropped by the trees that attack you. Use the updraft to catch a ride with your paraglider across the gap.

Coordinates: -3651, 1805, 0168

  • 5. Wao-os Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Optional
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. This shrine is under the Passer Hill area and its cave entrance is above the road west of Lake Totori, hidden on a dark ledge. This is much easier to find if you visit the cherry blossom tree shrine on Passer Hill. The coordinates for the cave entrance are -3951, 2033, 0201. Climb or run up the hill to the cave entrance and enter to discover West Lake Totori Cave. This is one of the rare cave entrances without a Blupee in front of it.

Coordinates: -4059, 1990, 0183

  • 6. Sahirow Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: Sahirow shrine is near the top of Corvash Peak in Hebra region, east, and a little bit north of Rospro Pass Skyview Tower. You can easily float there on your paraglider from the tower’s launch point. Alternatively, you can climb there starting from the Hebra Trailhead Lodge north of Rito Village.

Coordinates: -3354, 2387, 0361

  • 7. Tauyosipun Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Tauyosipun Shrine is located on the surface to the northwest of Rospro Pass Skyview Tower on the western side of Hebra West Summit. You can see it from the West Hebra Sky Archipelago if the clouds are right, but if you just float on your paraglider northwest from the tower, you should find it just over the peak.

Coordinates: -4535, 2878, 0262

  • 8. Otak Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. To find this shrine, you'll need to first find the Icefall Foothills Cave entrance, which you can on the west side of the Icefall Foothills (-4428, 3767, 0225). It's almost on the edge of the world. The cave entrance is blocked by ice. You can destroy the ice columns with Fire Fruit, or you can simply hold a weapon with the fire element up to it. This could be done by making a fire with wood and flint then catching the weapon on fire, or, even better, attaching something like a Fire-Breath Lizalfos Horn to a weapon. Regardless, you'll be melting a fair amount of ice here, so be prepared.

Coordinates: -4391, 3714, 0212

  • 9. Eutoum Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Eutoum shrine can be seen and reached from the Rospro Pass Skyview Tower launch. It is almost due north of the tower, and slightly east, in the far north edge of Hebra. It is on the far side of the peak range, and near a bit of water known as Goflam’s Secret Hot Springs.

Coordinates: -3509, 3568, 0387

  • 10. Rutafu-um Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. Make your way to Selmie's Spot northwest of Hebra East Summit. Near the bonfire you'll see a Blupee, looking north. Follow it and it'll lead you to a downward slope and the Hebra Mountains Northwest Cave.

Coordinates: -2996, 3102, 0515

  • 11. Sisuran Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Sisuran shrine base is along the north Hebra mountains, northwest and over the mountains from the Pikida Stonegrove Skyview Tower.

Coordinates: -2560, 3353, 0425

  • 12. Oshozan-u Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: You will need two warm clothes items (since you travel upwards from the ground to reach this shrine) or a cold resistant/warming elixir or food to reach Oshozan-u Shrine. It is on a rocky, icy pinnacle in the far north of Tabantha Snowdrift in the Tabantha Tundra. It’s a short ride north (and can be seen from) the Snowfield Stable.

  • 13. Mayaotaki Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Mayaotaki shrine is hidden in the center of the North Lomei Labyrinth.

Hebra and Tabantha Sky Shrines Guide and Locations

There are seven shrines to find in this northwest section of the sky above Hebra and Tabantha.

  • 1. Ganos Shrine Guide- Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Ganos Shrine is located in the Tabantha Frontier Sky.

Coordinates: -3367, 0468, 1695

advertisement
  • 2. Ga-ahisas Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Ga-ahisas Shrine is located on Lightcast Island, west of Lindor’s Brow Skyview Tower. Approach the stone circle on the west part of the island and touch the green hand field to activate. This will drain the water. Head toward the area where the spotlight is shining. Fight the Soldier Construct guarding the entrance. Use a rock-fused weapon or Bomb Flower to destroy the blocked entrance. Continue into the cave and solve the light reflection puzzle. After the platform raises, head to the right where you will find stairs that lead you down to the Ga-ahisas Shrine.

Coordinates: -3595, 0957, 1699

  • 3. Ijo-o Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine is easiest to reach after completing the quest with the Rito. Find out more information on how to get to this shrine in the Hebra Mountains Sky with the guide.

  • 4. Kahatanaum Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine is high above Hebra peak and is part of the main quest.

Coordinates: -3296, 3431, 1347

  • 5. Mayaumekis Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This shrine is high above Hebra peak and is part of the main quest.

Coordinates: -2947, 3051, 0897

  • 6. Tauninoud Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Tauninoud shrine, which is associated with the The East Hebra Sky Crystal Shrine Quest, can be started by reaching and activating the Shrine pad in Hebra Sky.

Coordinates: -2242, 3102, 1084

  • 7. Tenbez Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: The Tenbez Shrine is in the far north sky of Hyrule, you will need two parts of warming armor or a warming food or elixir to get there without losing health.

You can get there easiest from the Taninoud Shrine, which you can get to using the Taninoud Shrine Guide. From the Shrine, use the stone launcher to launch onto the northern island. Here, on the eastern edge, you’ll find a floating Zonai platform with a single fan sitting on it.

Attach the fan at a 45-degree angle pointing down and away from the large cube in the distance, this is where the Shrine is – due east. If you have rockets, you can attach them to make this journey faster. But the fan will get you there, you just need to stop and recharge a few times. Once high enough above the Shrine and a bit closer, you can paraglide down to it.

Coordinates: -0972, 2525, 1011

advertisement

Tabantha Shrines Guide and Locations

  • Mayausiy Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Mayausiy Shrine is located in a large, underground temple related to the Impa and the Geoglyphs quest line. However, you can just travel to the Shrine without activating the quest. In the Tabantha region you’ll find the northern end of Tanagar Canyon, a long canyon on the west side of Hyrule. This is the Forgotten Temple. You can climb up to its entrance and then follow the long space back to the Shrine, which is sitting just outside the chamber with the massive toppled Goddess statue.

  • Ikatak Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine sits empty on a dry plain above the Gisa Crater impact point.

advertisement
  • Turakawak Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Turakawak Shrine is in the far south of the Tabantha Frontier, south of the bottom turn of Tanager Canyon, and by a small lake called Lake Illumeni. It is out in the pen and easy to spot, but it is surrounded by thorns you can either burn away or better yet, avoid entirety by paragliding in from the nearby cliffside.

  • Iun-orok Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. If you keep seeing the “nearby shrine below” notification near Piper Ridge and Nero Hill in the Tabantha Frontier, your shrine in question is far below. Dive/glide down Tanagar Canyon near the wooden wind turbine, just east of the road that runs between Nero Hill and Piper Ridge. At the bottom of the canyon far under the hills you’ll spot an opening to a cave — the Tanagar Canyon West Cave. Proceed into the cave. Check out the Iun-orok shrine guide for more directions.

  • Gasas Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: In the far southwest of Tabantha Frontier, at the tail southwest end of the massive Tanagar Canyon you can find Gasas Shrine out in the open.

Hyrule Ridge Shrines Guide and Locations

  • Kiuyoyou Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: You'll find this shrine on the Rowan Plain, far northeast of Lindor's Brow Skyview Tower.

advertisement
  • Usazum Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: You'll find the empty shrine ring on the field west of Safula Hill and north of the Dalite Forest.

  • Sonapan Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: You'll find this shrine in an apple gove on the east side of Satori Mountain.

  • Makurukis Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Akkala Sky Shrines

  • Natak Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: From Ulri Mountain Skyview Tower, launch into the air and turn southeast. Your goal is to get to the small island next to the floating sphere – but it may be outside of your stamina range, so land on the eastern tip of the large island away from the enemy boss stalking the platform.

Here you’ll find a Zonai hovercraft-like device pre-built for the taking. First, add all the extra batteries nearby by using Ultrahand to glue them to the hovercraft. Head right for the sphere in the sky and land on the island with the rock launcher and gumball-machine-like Zonai Device Dispenser next to it. You should have one battery remaining of the six you started out with. Nice! Activate the Natak shrine platform and you will begin The Sokkala Sky Crystal Shrine Quest.

  • Gikaku Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: Gikaku Shrine is high above the spiral-shaped Rist Peninsula in the Akkala Sky. There is no easy way to get there without spare Zonai equipment. Starting from Ulri Mountain Skyview Tower, launch into the air and look for a small island with a circular pool and a tower on it. Paraglide to this island. SAVE YOUR GAME, as it's easy to mess up the next part of your journey. There are Zonai device parts here, but not nearly enough to get you to the northeast islands and Gikaku Shrine. To reach it, you’ll need three Fans, a Wing, a Controller, and two Batteries. The Wing and one Fan can be found on the island. The rest you’ll have to bring along from Zonai Device dispensers. Create a plane with three fans, a controller and two batteries. To get started you’ll need to use Ultrahand to move the plane into the air, and then safely back to the ground on the northeaster edge of the peninsula, then get on the wing, use Recall to lift you up and over into the air.

Deactivate recall and hop on the Controller. Pilot up and towards the nearest northeastern island. You should easily gain enough distance and height with two batteries and three fans to reach the island with the Gikaku Shrine platform. Activate the shrine pad so you can fast travel here. This will begin The Sky Mine Crystal Shrine Quest.

  • Mogisari Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Mogisari Shrine is located on the south side of the Lomei Sky Labyrinth in the far, far northeast corner of Hyrule. To get there from the surface, the closest tower is the Ulri Mountain Skyview Tower, but it’s a LONG WAY to the Shrine. You will either have create and eat a lot of stamina-increasing food to get there, or use Zonai devices.

Your target either way is a small sky island to the southwest of the labyrinth with a tower and a pool of water on it.

If you choose the stamina route: You’ll need about 4 rings of stamina to get here with the paraglider from the Skyview Tower. Cook these items and float to the island with the pool, north of the tower. This is the North Akkala Sky Archipelago.

If you choose the Zonai device route: Start at the Gikaku Shrine (go to the Gikaku Shrine Guide to see how to get there from the Skyview Tower). Use the stone launcher to get up to the second level of the Sky Mine. Here is a floating Zonai platform with two rockets and a Construct on it. Kill the Construct and get on the platform. Affix the two rockets to its surface, aimed at the North Akkala Sky Archipelago. Now, with the rockets firmly affixed, move the platform with Ultrahand allll the way to the north side of the island.

Get on the platform and activate the rockets to take you about half of the way to the island. From here you are high enough that you should be able to float down. If you have no stamina expansions, try using another rocket, or fan, affixed to the platform. Now, safely on the small island in the North Akkala Sky Archipelago, you will need an air ship to get you to the Labyrinth entrance above. Luckily, there’s one here. Among the Small Fairies is a perfectly useable fan-plane, and look down the steps on the north side for tons of extra batteries. A total of 8 batteries will get you there easily. The last leg of the journey will be assisted by low gravity as well!

Gerudo Sky Shrines Guide and Locations

advertisement
  • Rakashog Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: Due east of the Gerudo Desert Skyview Tower is a Shrine in the Sky called Rakashog – and you can get there via the closer islands to the tower. It sits on a high island in the Gerudo Sky in the East Gerudo Sky Archipelago. You can go right to the island beneath it if you have the stamina, or to a nearer one with a glider and rockets and fans you can use to get closer.

  • Mayasiar Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This Shrine is related to the Starview Island puzzle which involves mirrors and light beams inside a massive sphere with light, strange moon gravity – to get to this sphere, start at Gerudo Highlands Skyview Tower. Launch into the sky and look for a small island with a pool of water and tower nearby. Here you’ll find a single moveable platform with two rockets on it. Kill the Construct that’s guarding it. Get on the platform and attach one rocket to the center, fins down. Save the other for now, leaving it unattached. Activate the rocket and you’ll launch straight into the air, almost higher than the Skyview Island sphere. Now, take the other rocket and attach it a 45 degree angle and point the tip at the sphere. This will pull the platform up and a bit towards the sphere. Because this area is low gravity you can get a jump in and a paraglide to the top of the sphere. On the far side is the entrance to Skyview Island.

  • Siyamotsus Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The journey to Siyamotsus Shrine is a bit of a long one, and you will need either Zonai devices (a Fan or Rockets) and/or Stamina-increasing food (lots of Stambulbs are found on the East Gerudo Sky Archipelago to help) to reach it (unless you have 3 or more rings of Stamina). Siyamotsus Shrine is located on the north side of the labyrinth called South Lomei Castle in the southwest corner of Hyrule.

It’s easiest to start this journey from Rakoshog Shrine (see the Rakoshog Shrine guide for how to get here) on the East Gerudo Sky Archipelago, or from the Gerudo Canyon Skyview Tower. You want to get to the island in the south of this chain, below the Rakoshog Shrine. Here you will find several Zonai floating platforms. These are advantageous as they don’t lose altitude like a Wing, and one in particular has two rockets already on it. SAVE YOUR GAME. Leave one rocket and smack the attached one to lift high into the air. Use the other rocket to pull your platform closer to the large cube in the distance where the shrine is located. Attach it at a 45 degree angle pulling you up and towards the cube. Now, from your lofty perch, you can either attach a fan or a rocket to get closer from your inventory, or paraglide to the shrine using stamina and stamina-increasing food to extend your glide.

advertisement
  • Chichim Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Chichim Shrine is located in the Ancient Prison Ruins in the Gerudo Desert, southwest of Gerudo Canyon Skyview Tower. Head to the sinkhole in Palu Wasteland to discover the Ancient Prison Ruins. Follow the direction of statues with swords pointing the way to navigate the ruins and find the shrine's location.

  • Irasak Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Irasak Shrine is located in the Arbiter’s Grounds in the Gerudo Desert, southwest of Gerudo Canyon Skyview Tower. The shrine is surrounded by quicksand, which depletes your stamina quickly if you walk through it. One way to avoid the quicksand entirely is to locate the small building structure just north of the Arbiter’s Grounds. If you have completed the Lightning Temple, you can also start at the temple location. Get to the top of the structure and Paraglide to the shrine location.

  • Karahatag Shrine Guide
advertisement

  • Morok Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Since this shrine is on a low-flying Sky Island, it’ll take some ingenuity to get there. One method involved standing on top of the fallen piece of Sky Island on the south side of the small mountain south of the shrine (location 1255, -1034, 0144), Recalling it, and then jumping off and gliding to the shrine once the Recall takes it high enough.

Make sure to drop inside the small cage on the Morok Shrine Sky Island (location 1189, -0793, 0135), as there will be a chest inside holding a Large Zonai Charge. You can then stand on top of the spring and strike it with your sword to spring you out of the cage. You can then enter the shrine.

Alternatively, you can approach from the ground and climb up to the island by the roots dangling off its side. Be careful, though. Gloom Hands roam around the area, though they can't reach you if you're on the platform connected to the dangling roots.

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: If you've been searching for the shrine beneath the Upland Zorana Skyview Tower, you're almost there. This is one of the many shrines hidden within a cave. Specifically, you're looking for Ralis Channel. You can find it quickly by looking for Ralis Pond south of Upland Zorana Skyview Tower. It has two entrances and either will get you to the shrine.

advertisement
  • Ihen-a Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: The Ihen-a Shrine is located just west of Mipha Court, which is at the peak of Ploymus Mountain. If you’re currently working on the Regional Phenomena main story quest, then going to the Zora region will bring you to this Shrine organically. If not, you can just trek up the mountain to get to it or paraglide east after blasting off from the Upland Zorana Skyview Tower.

  • Apogek Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Apogek Shrine is due north of Mount Lanayru Skyview Tower and easy to reach from the tower. It is located under a rocky overhang so it is difficult to see from the sky, but it is on the surface and can be seen from nearby. It’s close to sea level just above Lanayru Bay and north of Brynna Plain.

  • Yomizuk Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. On the south edge of the Talus Plateau are some ruined columns. You should see a Blupee nearby too. Run to it and it'll lead you to a hole in the ground. Enter to discover the Tarm Point Cave. Deep within the cave you'll find the shrine. Find out exactly how to navigate the shrine with the Yomizuk Shrine Guide.

advertisement
  • Maoikes Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine located in a cave near Boné Pond in the Lanayru Wetlands, southwest of the Upland Zorana Skyview Tower. Run past the enemies into the cave. Climb onto the platform on the left side of the cave. Use Ascend to go through the surface above you to get to the shrine. Find out exactly how to navigate the shrine with the Maoikes Shrine Guide.

Lanayru Sky Shrines

  • Jirutagumac Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: From the Upland Zorana Skyview Tower launch into the sky. Below you will be a sphere with Jirutagumac Shrine within. Paraglide around the shrine to find the hole in the side of it, which is rotating. Activate the Shrine pad. Step foot inside to see why: A fan is on the wheel handles, rotating the shell of the sphere. Remove this and you can position the opening manually with the wheel. Do so and position the opening halfway above the floor. This will let you drop to the chest below the sphere’s floor by exiting the sphere opening and paragliding back through to the lower level. The chest here holds a Sage’s Will. Now, Ascend through the metal grate to the shrine level.

  • Igoshon Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Igoshon Shrine is located on Wellspring Island, east of Upland Zorana Skyview Tower. You can find this shrine during the Sidon of the Zora main quest. Link’s Zora Armor is helpful to climb waterfalls in the sky islands to reach the shrine.

  • Mayanas Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Mayanas Shrine is located in the South Lanayru Sky Archipelago, northeast of Mount Lanayru Skyview Tower. Launch into the sky from the Mount Lanayru Skyview Tower and use your Paraglider to head northeast. Land on the nearest sky island with a pre-built hovercraft. Use Ultrahand to grab a rocket from the floating platform and attach it to the flying device. Take control of the vehicle and fly up to the next sky island. Land and find the flying device at the end of the island. Use this vehicle to reach the shrine location and activate the green hand. This will begin The South Lanayru Sky Crystal shrine quest.

advertisement

Necluda Shrines Guide and Locations

  • En-oma Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The En-oma Shrine is in the Lake Hylia Whirlpool Cave underneath the whirlpool in Lake Hylia.

  • Susub Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Susub Shrine is in the Deya Village Ruins East Well northwest of the Popla Hills Skyview Tower.

advertisement
  • Jochisiu Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Jochisiu Shrine is located in the West Necluda region just south of the Squabble River. In order to uncover the shrine, you must complete the “Keys Born of Water” Shrine Quest by slotting blocks of ice into three uniquely shaped pedestals.

advertisement
  • O-ogim Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: O-ogim Shrine is located in the East Necluda region in the Lanayru Promenade. In order to uncover the shrine, you must complete the “Lanayru Road Crystal” Shrine Quest by bringing the crystal back to the shrine location.

  • Zanmik Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Zanmik Shrine is located on a hill south of Hataeno Village on the surface, in plain sight. It serves as the warp point for Hataeno Village.

  • Mayahisik Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. Mayahisik Shrine is in a cave you can discover called Resame Forest Cave and has two entrances, one blocked by destroyable rocks on the south side of the road to the Hateno Ancient Tech Lab. It’s in a passage directly under the road inside the cave. You'll also come across this shrine while on a side quest.

  • Sifumim Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge:Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Sifumim Shrine is located on the edge of the hill overlooking the ruined village, Lurelin Village. It’s west of Mount Dunsel and to the northeast of Tuft Mountain.

advertisement
  • Makasura Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: The Makasura Shrine is located on a small hill on the south side of Kakariko Village (location 1775, -1055, 0166). It’s in plain view after ascending the cliff.

  • Joju-u-u Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Joju-u-u Shrine is southwest of Popla Foothills Skyview Tower in East Faron it is near the southern coast of Hyrule and serves as the fast travel point for Lakeside Stable. It is visible from afar and up on a cliff high above the stable.

  • Eshos Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Eshos Shrine is located on the East Side of the Dueling Peaks, on a platform about a third of the way up the side of the northern cliff’s east side. We got there by Recalling a Sky Island piece east of the shrine (location 1769, -2029, 0013) and gliding straight to it, but you can also climb up the side of the cliff if you have the stamina.

advertisement
  • Utojis Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: The Utojis Shrine is located in Tobio’s Hollow Cave in the East Necluda Region, just southeast of the Popla Foothills, and west of the Jia Highlands.

  • Marari-in Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. You'll find the cave entrance on the back side of Eventide Island's highest peak, on the southeast side of the island. Once there you'll either have to do some major building to access the high cave inlet the shrine is in or complete the challenge on the island to access the shrine.

  • Tokiy Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This is a cave shrine. You'll find the cave entrance on the southeast side of Oakle's Navel, a small pond on the east side of West Necluda, just northeast of Mount Rozudo.

  • Anedamimik Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: In far east Necluda, just east of the Hateno Ancient Tech Lab, is a series of bays along the Hateno coast. Float off the Tech Lab’s cliff due east and you’ll come to Deepback Bay. Here the Deepback Bay Cave entrance can be found on a sandy beach, it leads into the mountains northward. There are some powerful Horriblins in Deepback Bay Cave, so beware – you can hit them off the ceiling with an arrow and finish them off as they recover. The cave chamber holding Anedamimik Shrine is flooded and you’ll need to drain the water to reach it. Look for a hole leading down just southwest of the shrine.

Here is a long pillar-like incline, a massive worm called a Like Like, and a patch of stone beyond it on the ceiling you can destroy to drain the water above. Luckily, this chamber has Bomb Flowers on the wall! You can choose to kill the Like Like or not, but all you need to do is shoot the cracked stones in the ceiling with a Bomb Flower fused to an arrow to drain the water and free the Shrine. Ascend through the roof once you do this and enter Anedamimik Shrine.

advertisement
  • Bamitok Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This cave shrine is located in the Mount Dunsel Cave. The cave entrance is to the east of Lurelin Village, southeast of Mount Dunsel, and directly north from Gama Cove. There will be a small pool of water in the entryway of the cave.

Necluda Sky Shrines Guide and Locations

  • Josiu Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Josiu Shrine is in the North Necluda Sky Archipelago. From the Sahasra Slope Skyview Tower, launch into the air and paraglide east. You’ll immediately come to some small bits of floating island that lead to larger ones below. From here you can easily glide to the larger island with the Shrine pad.

advertisement
  • Ukoojisi Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: From the Popla Foothills Skyview Tower, launch into the sky and float on your paraglider east and look for a few small stones leading to an island with a tower and pool on it. Land here in the West Necluda Sky Archipelago.

advertisement

Kill the Construct with the rockets and head to its platform. Here you can find two rockets. These can easily get the platform enough height for you to glide to the next island over with the shrine on it. Try attaching a rocket to the center of the pad vertically, and one at a 45 degree angle towards the island in the east – this will get you nearer.

Land on this island and activate the Ukoojisi Shrine pad to begin the West Necluda Sky Crystal Shrine Quest.

  • Kumamayn Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Kumamayn Shrine is located in the Necluda Sky Archipelago. Launch into the sky from the Rabella Wetlands Skyview Tower and use your Paraglider to head east. Find a floating platform with two stacked springs. Climb on top of the springs and hit to launch yourself into the sky. Glide to the next sky island to activate the green hand at the shrine location. This will begin the Necluda Sky Crystal shrine quest.

advertisement
  • Yansamin Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: Yansamin Shrine is located on Zonaite Forge Island in the East Necluda Sky, north of Rabella Wetlands Skyview Tower. If you have Zora Armor equipped, Link can swim up a waterfall located west of the Peak of Awakening in Lanyru. After arriving at Zonaite Forge Island, touch the green hand to activate the fans on the island. Use the Paraglider to travel from fan to fan until you reach the center cylinder with a hole in the middle. Jump into the hole while avoiding the red lasers. Activate the shrine.

advertisement

Great Hyrule Forest Shrines Guide and Locations

  • Musanokir Shrine Guide

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This Shrine is to the left when facing the front of the Great Deku Tree inside the Great Hyrule Forest.

  • Ekochiu Shrine Guide
advertisement

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine is out in the open just south of the Great Hyrule Forest and to the west of the Eldin Canyon Skyview Tower, you will most likely encounter it while on the road to the Lost Woods between Pico Pond and Minshi Woods.

advertisement
  • Pupunke Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine sits empty in the Great Hyrule Forest just east of the Great Deku Tree.

  • Ninjis Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Location: This shrine is located south of the Great Deku Tree, to reach it you must drop from the sky, with the easiest location being Bravery island which is almost directly above it.

  • Sakunbomar Shrine Guide - Shrine Quest Required

Shrine Challenge: Tap to Reveal

advertisement

Shrine Rewards: Tap to Reveal

Shrine Location: This shrine is located northwest of the Great Deku Tree in the Great Hyrule Forest, just past a Korok named Zooki.
